summary: This document appears to be a MoneyGram record retention and subpoena compliance policy document, likely part of a legal request for financial records in the Epstein investigation. It outlines procedures for obtaining money transfer and money order records, including searchable fields, retention periods, and contact information for legal requests.

locations.address: 1550 Utica Ave S MS: MIN-5508 Minneapolis, MN 55416
locations.context: MoneyGram mailing address for legal process and record requests

keyFacts: MoneyGram maintains money transfer records for 7 years and money order records for 7 years, searchable by reference number, consumer name, phone number, SSN, or other identifiers.
MoneyGram requires legal process for most record requests and may assess reasonable hourly fees for responding to legal process and third-party civil subpoenas.
The document provides specific contact information for MoneyGram's Global Security & Investigations department and SAR (Suspicious Activity Report) support.
MoneyGram's policy is to produce records only via secured and encrypted email when served with legal process or IRS Title 31 requests.
The document references scam awareness resources and fraud reporting procedures for consumers who may have been victimized through MoneyGram transfers.
